actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:00 a.m. on June 1, 2023.
The House received a communication from Representative Cicilline wherein he resigns as a member of the House of Representatives effective at close of business today.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 383
actions-list.actionItem: 18 (Roll no. 244).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 2797 — "To amend the Securities Act of 1933 to require certification examinations for accredited investors, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 2797, as amended which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by recorded vote: 314

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 3746.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3746 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 456. H.R. 3746 — "To provide for a responsible increase to the debt ceiling."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 31.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 429
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 242).

Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 382 — "Recognizing the significance of Jewish American Heritage Month as a time to celebrate the contributions of Jewish Americans to the society and culture of the United States."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to H. Res. 382, as amended which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 241

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question was ordered without objection.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 456.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 456 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3746) to provide for a responsible increase to the debt ceiling."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mrs. Hinson to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
